result.execSummary:
The defendant Dalton L Peck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Court will consider early discharge if recommended by Dept. of Corrections.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Dalton L Peck
Current: 178 W Park St, Apt. 111, Forestville, WI 54213   (Effective: 01-03-2014)
Prior: 178 W Park St, Apt. 105, Forestville, WI 54213
(rec'd by Court 9/11/14) from State with requested jury instructions

Defendant Dalton L Peck in court with attorney Colleen Nordin.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor criminal trespass to property as party to a crime. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1-3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1-3. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Motion hearing on January 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on December 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
for Admission of Other Acts Evidence
by Defendant to Disclose Delinquency Adjudications
by State to Impeach with Evidence of Prior Convictions

Defendant Dalton L Peck in court with attorney Colleen Nordin.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, advises trial is in the #2 position behind a juvenile case.  Atty Nordin advises matter is still proceeding to trial at this point. Atty Nordin just became aware of new charges for one of the witnesses, needs some time to look into other acts motion. Discussion on number of adjudications for defendant. Judge Diltz and Judge Ehlers both signed order regarding juvenile adjudications, Atty Nordin will now be able to look at those files. Atty Nordin asks court to adjourn trial to deal with pending motions and look into new charges of witness. State feels trial should be left on the calendar, makes statement. Court not taking the trial off the calendar at this point, any motions to be filed by 9/10/14.  Bond remains in effect.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 11:45 am.
Jury trial on September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant Dalton L Peck in court with attorney Colleen Nordin.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that case be set for trial and pre-trial.

Defendant Dalton L Peck in court with attorney Colleen Nordin.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is working on obtaining information regarding witnesses, case is not resolved, is not certain that all the information needed has been obtained.  State advises that if case is set for trial, offer will be taken off the table.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Dalton L Peck in court with attorney Colleen Nordin.  Defendant Dalton L Peck in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Dalton L Peck in court with attorney Megan M. Carollo, who appears on behalf of Colleen Nordin.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Initial appearance on January 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with BG, SS, AC, BC.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Dalton L Peck appeared by video conference.  Attorney Eric Maciolek appeared by phone.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Atty Maciolek advises that he will not be handling case, will attempt to have counsel appointed by 1/6.
